content: The Act is titled the "Stop Trading on Congressional Knowledge Act" and pertains to nonpublic information related to Congress. The Securities Exchange Act of 1934 is amended to prohibit buying or selling securities of any issuer while in possession of material nonpublic information related to pending legislative actions involving the issuer, if obtained from or by a Member or employee of Congress. Disclosure rules are also established. The Commission will prohibit disclosure of material nonpublic information related to pending legislative actions by Members or employees of Congress to prevent trading based on such information. Additionally, rules will be established to prohibit buying or selling commodities based on nonpublic information related to Congress. The Commission will prohibit trading commodities based on nonpublic information related to pending legislative actions by Members or employees of Congress. Additionally, disclosure of such information will also be prohibited. The Commission prohibits trading commodities based on nonpublic information related to pending legislative actions by Members or employees of Congress. Disclosure of such information is also prohibited. SEC. 3. TIMELY REPORTING OF SECURITIES TRANSACTIONS. Amendment to the Ethics in Government Act of 1978 requires Members of Congress and legislative branch employees to report transactions involving at least $1000 in stocks, bonds, or other securities within 30 days. Effective 90 days after enactment. SEC. 4. REGISTRATION OF POLITICAL INTELLIGENCE FIRMS. The Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 is amended to include definitions for political intelligence activities, which involve contacts, preparation, research, and coordination in support of political intelligence efforts. The Lobbying Disclosure Act of 1995 is amended to include definitions for political intelligence activities, specifically defining a political intelligence contact as a communication made on behalf of a client regarding Federal legislation analysis for securities or commodities markets. This definition excludes communications made by or to media representatives for the purpose of gathering information. The communication aims to gather and share news and information with the public.
